page.title: 07BLACKROD VILLAGE (SCHOOLS)
page.content: There are three primary schools: Scot Lane C.E. School, opened in 1870, Blackrod County Primary, opened in 1969 and housed in the building formerly occupied by the secondary modern school, and Blackrod Anglican Methodist Church School, opened in 1980. This last school replaced the old Parish School of 1845 which is now St.Katharine's Parish Hall. On completing their primary schooling, the majority of children transfer to Rivington & Blackrod High School, an 11 to 18 comprehensive school. The former Blackrod Grammar School in Church Street, built in 1799, was incorporated with the Free Grammar School at Rivington in 1881 and the building is now used as the local council office.
